bug.author: karriebear
bug.summary: Trim whitespace when a string is provided to st.image
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
It would be great to trim the whitespace from any strings provided into st.image. Right now if something starts with \n it will produce the following error now that we support svg as strings as an input. <denchmark-code>FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '\n<svg width="40" height="40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">\n <circle id="svg_1" r="15" cy="20" cx="20" fill="yellow"/>\n</svg>' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>svg = """ <svg width="40" height="40" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"> <circle id="svg_1" r="15" cy="20" cx="20" fill="yellow"/> </svg> """ st.image(svg) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Renders image <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Gets error <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24946400/89963486-b9ed9300-dc15-11ea-878a-031a277121ed.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Nope
